structure.unit: COUNTIES, CITIES, AND OTHER LOCAL UNITS

law.catch_line: Extension of urban services -- Notice to property owner.

text.section: The chief executive officer of the urban-county government shall notify each property owner by certified mail, of the urban-county government intention to extend urban services which may result in a tax increase to the property owner.
The notice by the chief executive officer shall fix the time and place of a public hearing on the extension of urban services for the affected property.
The notice shall be postmarked no less than ten (10) days prior to the date of the public hearing and thirty (30) days prior to the extension of urban services.
The notice provision shall not apply to extension of urban services, when less than ten (10) contiguous individual parcels of property are to be affected by the extension of urban services.

law.history: Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 243, sec. 2, effective June 21, 1974.
